{{infobox character | people=[[Rohirrim|Rohir]] | name=Gálmód | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location= | affiliation= | language=[[Rohanese]] and [[Westron]] | birth=Late [[Third Age]] | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Gríma]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Gálmód''' was a man of [[Rohan]]. ==History== Gálmód must have been born and flourished around the 30th century of the [[Third Age]];[[Robert Foster]], ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'', entry "Gálmód" he was the father of [[Gríma|Gríma Wormtongue]], the advisor to [[Théoden|King Théoden]] of [[Rohan]].{{TT|King}} ==Etymology== The name ''Gálmód'' seems to derive from the [[Old English]] word for "light-minded, licentious"[[Wayne G. Hammond]], [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'', page 404 or "light, wanton mood".[[Ruth S.
